Elementary table

t_el_forest_rsp.Rd

Elementary Table for Forest Response Plot

t_el_forest_rsp(
  rsp,
  col_by,
  strata_data = NULL,
  conf_level = 0.95,
  row_name = "",
  dense_header = FALSE
)

Arguments

rsp

(logical vector)
TRUE if subject is a responder FALSE otherwise
col_by

(logical, factor or data.frame)
Contains reference and comparison group information, the first level indicates the reference group. See the functions col_by_to_matrix and by_add_total.
strata_data

(character, factor or data.frame)
Used for stratification factors If NULL, no stratified analysis is performed.
conf_level

(numeric value) confidence level of the interval
row_name

(character value) name of row
dense_header

(logical value) Display the table headers in multiple rows.

Value

rtable with one row

See also

t_forest_rsp

Examples

rsp = sample(c(TRUE, FALSE), 200, TRUE)
col_by = factor(sample(c("ARM A", "ARM B"), 200, TRUE), levels = c("ARM A", "ARM B"))
strata_data <- data.frame(
  STRATA1 = sample(c("STR1", "STR2"), 200, TRUE),
  STRATA2 = sample(c("low", "medium", "high"), 200, TRUE)
)
t_el_forest_rsp(
  rsp = rsp,
  col_by = col_by
)
#>                                                                            ARM A                                                          ARM B                                                                   
#> Baseline Risk Factors           Total n                 n               Responders          Response.Rate              n               Responders          Response.Rate         Odds Ratio             95% CI    
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>                                   200                  109                  48                  0.44                  91                   52                  0.57                 1.69             (0.97, 2.97) 

t_el_forest_rsp(
  rsp = rsp,
  col_by = col_by,
  strata_data = strata_data
)
#>                                                                            ARM A                                                          ARM B                                                                   
#> Baseline Risk Factors           Total n                 n               Responders          Response.Rate              n               Responders          Response.Rate         Odds Ratio*            95% CI    
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>                                   200                  109                  48                  0.44                  91                   52                  0.57                  1.7               (0.96, 3)
